name: allegheny-county-hydrology-areas
notes:
The Hydrology Feature Dataset contains photogrammetrically compiled waterrndrainage features and structures including rivers, streams, drainage canals,rnlocks, dams, lakes, ponds, reservoirs and mooring cells.u00a0 Lakes are large standing bodies of waterrngreater than 5 acres in size. Ponds are large standing bodies of water greaterrnthan 1 acre and less than 5 acres in size. Polygons are created from Streamrnedges and River Edges.u00a0 The Ohio River,rnMonongahela River and Allegheny River are coded as Major River polygons.u00a0 All other River and Stream polygons are codedrnas River. A Drainage Canal is a manmade or channelized hydrographicrnfeature.u00a0 Drainage Canals arerndifferentiated from streams in that drainage canals have had the sides and/orrnbottom stabilized to prevent erosion for the predominant length of thernfeature.u00a0 Streams may have had somernstabilization done, but are primarily in a natural state. Lakes are largernstanding bodies of water greater than five acres in size.u00a0 Ponds are large standing bodies of waterrngreater than one acre in size and less than five acres in size.u00a0 Reservoirs are manmade embankments ofrnwater.u00a0 Included in this definition arernboth covered and uncovered water tanks. Reservoirs that are greater than onernacre in size are digitized. Hidden Streams, Hidden Rivers and Hidden DrainagernCanal or Culverts are those areas of drainage where the water flows through arnmanmade facility such as a culvert. Hydrology Annotation is not being updatedrnbut will be preserved.u00a0 If a drainagernfeature has been removed, as apparent on the aerial photography, the associatedrndrainage name annotation will be removed. A Mooring Cell is a structure tornwhich tows can tie off while awaiting lockage.u00a0rnThey are normally constructed of concrete and steel and are anchored tornthe river bottom by means of gravity or sheet piling. Mooring Cells do notrncurrently exist in the Allegheny County dataset but will be added. Locks arerndevices that are used to control flow or access to a hydrologic feature.u00a0 The edges of the Lock are captured.u00a0 Dams are devices that are used to hold orrndelay the natural flow of water.u00a0 Thernedges of the Dam are shown.

rnrn

If viewing this description on the Western PennsylvaniarnRegional Data Centeru2019s open data portal (
>http://www.wprdc.org), thisrndataset is harvested on a weekly basis from Allegheny Countyu2019s GIS data portalrn(

>http://openac.alcogis.opendata.arcgis.com/). Thernfull metadata record for this dataset can also be found on Allegheny Countyu2019srnGIS portal. You can access the metadata record and other resources on the GISrnportal by clicking on the u201cExploreu201d button (and choosing the u201cGo to resourceu201drnoption) to the right of the u201cArcGIS Open Datasetu201d text below.

Development Notes:u00a0 Original Lakes and Drainage datasets combinedrnto create this layer. Data was updated as a result of a flyover in the spring ofrn2004. A database field has been defined for all map features named "UpdaternYear". This database field will define which dataset provided each maprnfeature. Map features from the current map will be set to "2004". Thernearlier dataset map features the earlier dataset map features used tornsupplement the area near the county boundary will be set to "1993".rnAll new or modified map data will have the value for "Update Year"rnset to "2004".u00a0

extras.value: Allegheny County / City of Pittsburgh / Western PA Regional Data Center

organization.description: Allegheny County (Pennsylvania) and the City of Pittsburgh both publish their data through the Western Pennsylvania Regional Data Center. The Western Pennsylvania Regional Data Center supports key community initiatives by making public information easier to find and use. The Data Center maintains Allegheny County and the City of Pittsburghu2019s open data portal, and provides a number of services to data publishers and users. The Data Center also hosts datasets from these and other public sector agencies, academic institutions, and non-profit organizations. The Data Center is managed by the University of Pittsburghu2019s Center for Social and Urban Research, and is a partnership of the University, Allegheny County and the City of Pittsburgh.
